content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

stranger

Related words are:

- know
- person
- meeting

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

content.thinking:
Let me make sure I understand the task:

I need to describe the word "stranger" so that someone can guess it, but I cannot use the following words in my description:
- stranger (the target word)
- know 
- person
- meeting

I need to be brief and to the point because I'm under time pressure.

Let me think about ways to describe "stranger" without using those forbidden words:

- Someone unfamiliar
- Individual you haven't encountered before
- An unknown individual 
- Someone you're unfamiliar with
- A random human you don't recognize
- Someone who is new to you
- Someone unfamiliar you might see on the street
- Opposite of a friend or acquaintance
- Someone you've never seen before
- Unfamiliar individual

I need to be careful not to use "person" (should use individual, human, someone instead), "know" (should use familiar, recognize, acquainted instead), and "meeting" (should use encounter, see, interact instead).

I'll go with a simple, clear clue that avoids all these words:

content.text: CLUE: Someone who is completely unfamiliar to you, whom you've never seen before.

clem_player.response: CLUE: Someone who is completely unfamiliar to you, whom you've never seen before.

content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: Someone who is completely unfamiliar to you, whom you've never seen before.

content.thinking:
Let me think about the clue: "Someone who is completely unfamiliar to you, whom you've never seen before."

This is describing a person who is unknown to me, someone I've never encountered. Here are some possible words that fit this description:

- Stranger: A person whom one does not know or with whom one is not familiar
- Unknown: Not known or familiar
- Foreigner: A person born in or coming from a country other than one's own
- Newcomer: A person who has recently arrived in a place or joined a group
- Outsider: A person who does not belong to a particular group

Among these options, "stranger" seems to be the most direct match for the clue. It specifically refers to someone who is unfamiliar and whom you've never met before.

So my first guess will be "stranger".

content.text:
I need to guess the word based on the clue: "Someone who is completely unfamiliar to you, whom you've never seen before."

GUESS: stranger

clem_player.response:
I need to guess the word based on the clue: "Someone who is completely unfamiliar to you, whom you've never seen before."

GUESS: stranger
